intro: Gethyllis campanulata, commonly known as the bell-shaped gethyllis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in spring and are often clustered in umbels. Gethyllis campanulata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in rock gardens and containers.
